results.title: A Letter to Amy
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Peter, a young African American boy, who is planning his birthday party. Shows him pondering over the invitation letter and then anxiously awaiting the party day to see if she comes. Concludes with Amy arriving very late, thus making the party a happy one.

results.title: A Letter for John
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: No. 2 in the Junior Social Studies series this film shows how John, a boy who lives in Bathurst, New South Wales, receives a letter through the post from his friend Peter, who lives in Manly, Sydney, New South Wales.

results.title: A Lesson to us all
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face Australia”.
Outwardly, Japan is an economic and industrial giant, whose growth from the ashes of WWII into a powerful trading nation is a remarkable success story. This film looks at both sides of the Japanese story, contrasting the nation’s material wealth and manufacturing efficiency with the divisions created by changed social conditions, the tragic effects of uncontrolled pollution and pessimistic outlooks of concerned citizens.

results.title: A Lecture on anatomy
results.creator_credit: Geo Tapparelli, Lux Film and Glauco Pellegrini
results.brief_description: This Italian art film is an essay on the theory that “the shape of the human body is determined by necessity and regulated by a principle which gives the greatest result for the least effort - the best of engineers could not invent a more perfect and economical structure. Humans could not be different from what they are because they could not be simpler”. Commentary in English.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geo Tapparelli, Lux Film and Glauco Pellegrini

results.title: A Kite story
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Pieter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: A story about a boy, two kites, and a stranger who makes the kites. He gives the boy a small white kite, to which he is very attached until he sees the glittering rocket kite…The tale is adventure and fantasy, and indicates the values of friendship and loyalty.

results.title: A Kind of seeing: the colour of Scotland
results.creator_credit: IFA (Scotland), Films of Scotland and Edward McConnell
results.brief_description: An abstract colour impression of Scotland throughout the four seasons of the year. The camera focused on flowers, the surface of ponds and the winter sky. There is no commentary, the background music was composed by Frank Spedding.

results.title: A Killing rain (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Taylor, United Nations Environment Programme and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Acid rain is one aspect of environmental pollution discussed at the Public Hearing in London in 1982. This program travels from Scotland to Scandinavia to West Germany to uncover background causes and the effects of this major pollution problem of the 80s.

results.title: A Kibbutz
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the establishment of the kibbutz. Describes community organisation, and the changing role of women on the kibbutz. Shows the progress of a child through the system. Discussion ensues when two of the haberim wish to leave the kibbutz - problems and advantages are aired.

results.title: A Journey that wasn't
results.brief_description: A Journey that wasn’t is a colour video work that intersperses footage of an expedition to the Antarctic circle with shots of a concert held on an ice rink in Central Park, New York. Aside from a brief voice-over early in the film that provides a small amount of background information about the expedition, the rest of the work is not narrated.
